DefaultFragmentShader - Class in fast3d.simple.fragment
a default implementation of FragmentShader
subclasses are permitted the possibility to override only some methods described in the doc of FragmentShader
default implementation uses the built-in phong illumination model and capable of handling perspective and orthographic shading
CameraMode.oriented and CameraMode.inscreen are implicitly considered true and neither touched nor handled
DefaultFragmentShader(Universe, BufferedImage, Rectangle) - Constructor for class fast3d.simple.fragment.DefaultFragmentShader
calls super constructor
DefaultFragmentShader(Universe, BufferedImage) - Constructor for class fast3d.simple.fragment.DefaultFragmentShader
calls super constructor
DefaultFragmentShader(Universe, int, int) - Constructor for class fast3d.simple.fragment.DefaultFragmentShader
calls super constructor with the a plain image in the specified size of type BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB and the rectangle area being the entire image
DefaultFragmentShaderManager - Class in fast3d.simple.fragment
a default implementation of FragmentShaderManager using DefaultFragmentShader
DefaultFragmentShaderManager(Universe, int) - Constructor for class fast3d.simple.fragment.DefaultFragmentShaderManager
calls super constructor

DirectionalLight - Class in fast3d.complex.light
a directional light just works as sunlight on earth

directionOfLight(Illuminatable) - Method in class fast3d.complex.light.PointLight

dotP(Vector2d) - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector2d
calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
does not change the parameter
dotP(Vector2d, Vector2d) - Static method in class fast3d.math.Vector2d
calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
does not change the parameter
dotP(Vector3d) - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector3d
calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
does not change both the parameter or this
dotP(Vector3d, Vector3d) - Static method in class fast3d.math.Vector3d
the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
dotP(Vector4d) - Method in class fast3d.math.Vector4d
calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
does not change both the parameter or this
dotP(Vector4d, Vector4d) - Static method in class fast3d.math.Vector4d
the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
drawString(String, Vector3d) - Method in class fast3d.graphics.Graphics3d
shades the given vertex and uses the pixel to determine where to draw a 2d-string on the screen
works just fine for call-outs, remember the text will be not 3d
